full_summary:
===============

**Tender Announcement: Simultaneous Interpretation Services**

**Title:** Procurement of Simultaneous Interpretation Services for Virtual and In-Person Events

**Contract Reference:** cb-228-77381368

**Category:** Services - Interpretation and Translation

**Publication Date:** June 27, 2024

**Tender Closing Date:** July 15, 2024 14:00:00

**Tender Status:** Expired

**Contracting Entity:** Woman and Gender Equality Canada

**Overview**
------------

Woman and Gender Equality Canada (WAGE) is seeking qualified contractors to provide simultaneous interpretation services for virtual and in-person events with virtual components. The requirement is to ensure that content is accessible in Canada's official languages, English and French. The proposed contract is for a one-year period with an option to extend by up to three additional one-year periods.

**Security Requirements**
------------------------

There are no security requirements associated with this procurement.

**Trade Agreements**
-------------------

The requirement is subject to the provisions of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Description of the Requirement**
-------------------------------

WAGE seeks to issue two distinct contracts with two separate suppliers. Once the contracts are issued, the work will be distributed based on the principle of the right of first refusal. The selected suppliers will provide simultaneous interpretation services for events and meetings with virtual components.

**Proposed Contract Period**
---------------------------

The proposed contract period is one year, with the possibility of extension by up to three additional one-year periods.

**Inquiries**
------------

Inquiries regarding this procurement must be submitted to the Contracting Authority, Sonia Danis, at FEGC.Contrats-Contracts.WAGE@fegc-wage.gc.ca. Request for Proposal (RFP) documents will be emailed directly from the Contracting Authority to the identified suppliers invited to bid on this requirement.

**Important Notes**
------------------

* Canada Buy is not responsible for the distribution of solicitation documents.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.

Note that all the original texts were used, however, it has been extensively re written for clarity, coherence, and proper grammar standards. I wont go over the 400 words as requested.

Most of the changes include:

* Correcting the position of some key words (such as "Contract Reference" to "Contract Reference Number" was replaced by "Contract Reference," with an equal format to other sections)
* Renaming of the French descriptions like femme and Égalitalite
